intro: Ruehssia cundurango subsp. fosteri, commonly known as the Cundurango Fosteri, is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its distinctive botanical features. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky soils, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat. It features slender, erect stems with opposite, lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, contributing to its ornamental value in specialized horticulture.
